38065013.review:
Not particularly hard--I'm kind of bad at shooters and cleared it without continuing on my second try. There is a lot of room for improvement and you can always start on a higher rank.
The game nails the look and feel aspect. It's got this real raw grimy aesthetic from the FM chip-type music to the primary color wireframe pixel art designs. Good feedback on stuff blowing up. Controls well. Just feels really great to play.

37303299.review:
低ランクは弾消し可能な低速単発弾、高ランクは高速高密度弾幕が飛び交う弾幕STG。
操作はオーソドックスなショット&ボムの2ボタン。自機は解禁で全12種。
ステージは5つ(解禁状況で裏ステージが4つ)の1周エンドだが中ボス含めてボス形態は200種以上。エンディングは3種。
難易度の根幹を成すランクは0～500で初期ランク設定やアイテム取得や被弾等で変動していく。
BGM良し。楽しんで

37121202.review: シューティングゲームはこれが初めてなので他の作品と比較はできませんがボスのデザインとＢＧＭが素晴らしいです

33801747.review:
The game delivers on every aspect of this amazing shmup title. It looks, sounds, and plays great. However, if you're a veteran shmup enthusiast it will be a little on the easy side. Even with the adaptive difficulty changing according to your playstyle it still really didn't give me too much of a threat. Bosses I guess were pretty fun to battle with and was actually decently challenging.

If you wanted to know, I did beat the game upon release, and it was my first ever playthrough. No deaths.

And the soundtrack sounds so good. If you have high-quality headphones you will really enjoy the FM music in this game.

I recommend it,

31791241.review:
Heard this recommended on shmups.system11 as a shmup to not overlook and it was half off on a sale so I took the plunge.
Verdict: Super solid shmup.

While numbers are not everything, I do think they're a big deal in shmups, so here's some quick and dirty stats to entice you, curious buyer:
- There's 6 playable ships, each with two different versions that play almost entirely different (effectively making it 12 ships).
- 5 stages, with completely different alternate versions of stages 2,3, and 4, 2 final bosses, and a true end final boss.
- The game description wasn't lying when it said there's a mix of 40 bosses and mid-bosses. And they're mostly really good.
- Dynamic difficulty system that works surprisingly well.
- Good stage training modes and boss rush modes for practicing.

And it's not just all stats either, it's got the good game design to go along with it: 
Some ships function very differently from others and will force you to heavily adapt how you play the game. Bosses are menacing and will not shy away from getting right up in your face, forcing you to leave the comfort zone at the bottom of the screen. Bosses sometimes come in groups and often times have strategic dismemberment. 
The dynamic difficulty system affects game speed, enemy attack difficulty, and your own attack power, and will adapt to provide an easier experience if you're struggling, and a tougher experience if you manage to keep up.
The music isn't mind-blowing but it complements the action nicely and some tracks will stick with you.

All in all, pretty great. It's not nearly stellar or stylish enough to threaten Hellsinker's throne, but it's the closest I've seen a shmup get in a long time and you won't want to miss it.

31231455.review: 入正之前就已经拿着D版玩了很长时间了，品质非常高的像素风STG，这种疯狂的版面玩起来很带感。

30606733.review: Mecha Ritz's originality feels like a breath of fresh air in the Shoot 'Em Up genre. Fast paced action with an FM Synth soundtrack. I wish more games were this fun. A tour de force, no less.

30307168.review:
旧き良きSTG（の皮を被った今風シュー）

元はデザエモンで作ったSTGだそうで
フリゲからスチームへと転身
基本的な部分はフリゲと同じようですが、
演出なんかはスチーム版の方がブラッシュアップされてます
ゲーム部分は他の方が書かれてる通りで
初心者から上級者まで幅広く楽しめる内容
それを可能にしているのがシールド制とランクシステム
シールドは抱え落ちを防ぎ、
ランクは画面に表示される（ザナックかよ）ので
低ランクで楽々クリアというのも簡単
高ランクでは悶絶級の高速弾幕を楽しめます

残念なのは実績とオンラインスコアがないとこくらい
現状セールはしてないようですがサントラ付きを買いましょう
損はしません。

30018644.review:
The game can pinpoint and shave the difficulty as I'm playing, making the experience feel challenging but manageable at the same time. As someone who's not very skilled at shoot-em-ups, this makes all the difference, it never gets too overwhelming, but it's not pandering either. 
I haven't played too much, but I'm feeling like later you want to get better at it, so you keep the difficulty high by dying less. It's a pretty neat system.

Also, music is glorious, cranked up bleeps and bloops. Almost nonsensical cutscenes are pretty cute.

Even if shmups aren't your thing, try this one. It's quite accessible in pretty interesting ways.

29398608.review:
요약 : 레트로그래픽에 거부감을 가지지 않았다면 누구에게도 추천할만한 탄막슈팅게임

-

레트로 그래픽을 가진 탄막슈팅게임 메카리츠 입니다.

플레이 시간은 전 스테이지 클리어 기준으로 한판에 약 30분 정도. 크게 부담되는 시간은 아닙니다.

가장 큰 특징으로는 자기가 생각하는 실력에 따라 정할수 있는 초기 랭크와, 게임 도중의 행동에따라 실시간으로 변하는 가변성 랭크입니다.
랭크를 어느정도로 시작하건간에 자신에 실력에 맞도록 조정이 되어서 이제 슈팅을 처음하는 사람이던 충분히 실력이 있는 사람이던 즐길수 있는 게임이죠.
랭크에 따라서 기체의 샷 파워 및 스테이지 스크롤 속도가 변하고, 이에 따라서 엔딩에 가장 큰 영향을 끼치는 분기 및 엔딩여부가 변하니 가장 낮은 랭크를 유지하면서 한판깨고 그만둘 게임은 아니에요.

필드전 보다는 수많은 미니보스를 통한 보스전에 주력한 느낌입니다.
 스테이지 중간중간 못해도 세번 이상의 중보스가 준비되어있고, 중보스 격파 전후 및 어려운 구간 진입시 대비할수 있게 충분한 아이템을 지급합니다.

이제 막 슈팅에 입문해서 탄막슈팅이 어떤지 체험하려는 사람도, 파고들기를 좋아하는 하드 슈터도 만족할수 있는 흔치 않은 슈팅게임이 아닐까 생각합니다.

28818727.review:
「殺られる前に殺る」事が必要とされる怒涛の弾幕ながら、5段階まで張れるシールド、大量に獲得できるボム、そしてプレイ状況によって難易度が調整される「RANK」システムによってシューティングはそれほど得意だと思っていない自分も裏ルート含めてクリアできました。

個性ある12の自機で気分に合わせて色々試せるのも面白かったです。敵弾かすりでゲージを満タンにすると全体ダメージ、自弾で敵弾消しができるといった特殊な物もあります。

レトロ音源風のBGMはキャッチーで聴き応えがあり、サントラでも度々聴いています。特にお気に入りなのは裏ルートのラストバトル曲です。

効果音、グラフィック、BGM、そしてテキストで独特な世界が作り上げられていて、是非とも多くの人に体験してもらいたいタイトルだと思いました。

28425581.review:
Un Schmup qu'il est bien pour les débutants.
Et pour les joueurs les plus avertis bah il gère aussi avec un système de ranking évolutif. Et y'a plein de petite subtilité de gameplay à découvrir.
En plus il est joli (si,si) et les boss sont rigolos.

27736631.review:
From now on, Mecha Ritz is THE shoot ’em up. Forget about Crimzon Clovers, DoDonPachis and Mushihimesamas. There is only Mecha Ritz. It’s so creative that it will surprise you again and again. It’s so dynamic that it will put you into constant shooting-n-dodging trance. And it’s music rocks. 
Buy this fucking game.

26753534.review:
非常に面白かったです。
初心者におすすめしたいSTGだと思います。
というのも、シールド制であり、ランク制かつ、機体の種類が豊富だからです。

まず、当ゲームはコンティニューが存在しません。
これに関しては、賛否別れると思いますが、私は良いシステムだと思います。
昨今のSTGにおける基本「抱え落ちをしない」ことを十二分に学べますし、何より、少しずつ攻略する楽しさがしっかり味わえると感じています。
そして、シールドも最大5個ストックでき、被弾により削られても、容易に再取得出来ます。
また、ランク制により敵弾の密度や速度にも補正が掛かるため、自然とプレーヤーに応じた難易度になるのも面白い点ではないでしょうか。

私自身、下手の横好きでしたが、こちらの作品は各機体でのクリアが出来るまでに上達しました。
FM音源が織りなすBGMも素敵です。ゲームを通して良いなと思った方はOSTもありますので、購入を検討してみてはいかがでしょうか。

25781351.review:
http://www.bilibili.com/video/av6470064/
作为音游！音乐超级棒！剧情也厉害！

25356540.review:
This is a really really good shmup. It's beatable if you aren't that good, since the RANK will stay low and you'll be able to handle things, but also very challenging if you're good at the genre since you can consistently raise your rank and face down very difficult bosses and enemies (with a high score to match). Lots of ships to unlock, good music, bad anime artwork in the cutscenes, and ludicrous translation -- it's basically perfect. Plus it's cheap! The one problem I have with it -- and it is indeed a problem -- is that it doesn't have autofire. Please do not make shmups without autofire, I would like my keyboard to remain healthy and strong!!

e: for some reason steam's time measure doesn't work very well on this game. i have played it more than 5 minutes, honest

25340005.review:
I'm not going to give a super long review on this game, as the reviews here are already pretty detailed. But this game shouldn't be glossed over, it's a fantasticly addictive shmup! It has just enough ship variety, just enough challenge thanks to the adaptive difficulty system in place, and even the story is enjoyable, albeit simple.

If you're a fan of shmups or even new to the genre, this is a pretty great game that you should check out. Highly recommended.

25279760.review:
I'm always awestruck when the credits roll and there is a single name listed for nearly every position.  I suppose this has happened frequently lately mainly due to the types of games I've been playing.  As you may have already guessed, this is the case with Mecha Ritz: Steel Rondo.  If it weren't for Hanaji Games bringing Yuki Shouhei's (or HEY for short) game to Steam it's likely I never would have played it, which would have been unfortunate as it's one cool shooting game.

Mecha Ritz: Steel Rondo is a Japanese indie shmup that was formed around the goal of creating an STG that could be accessible to players of all levels.  Normally this is achieved by having several difficulty settings, but this game takes quite a different approach.  There is a rank that is adjusted up and down depending on how well you're playing.  I was skeptical at first, but it's handled in an ingenious manner.

One might wager that playing well is defined as avoiding enemy fire, but it's not that simple.  The system takes several variables of play style into account such as using bombs appropriately, avoiding bullets, the speed enemies are killed, and also the distance enemies are killed from.  Rank is adjusted in real time so the challenge will rise and fall depending on your performance.  When starting the game rank is set to zero by default, but it can be increased in order to have a higher difficulty right out of the gate.  The fact that the game is generous with extra lives, shields, and bombs combines well with the ranking system.  I quickly found myself playing aggressively to boost rank as much as I could handle knowing that there were ample resources available.

Playing aggressively will lead to trying to kill bosses as quickly as possible, and killing bosses quickly will lead to different endings.  I've seen three endings and quite a few branching paths for alternate stages.  After playing a small amount of time extra Mecha (ships) will be unlocked.  The Mechas all have a unique primary fire, secondary fire, bombs, and other assorted attributes such as movement speed.  Two Mechas even have an awesome graze mechanic that encourages and rewards riskier play.  Mecha Ritz has a large amount of content, but the game doesn't do the best job at letting you know about it.

There is a text file in the game's directory that should absolutely be read before playing.  I found myself frustrated by the lack of ability to return to the title screen while playing, but it turns out it's possible and explained in the file.  It might have been more logical to simply have a pause menu with a quit option rather than holding three buttons though. There is no notification at all when you unlock a new ship, and I can imagine someone not even knowing that ships beyond the first six exist as they technically don't have icons of their own.  The menu initially felt a little strange to maneuver, but works fine once you get the hang of it.  Other than that, there isn't much else to say that I viewed as potentially negative.

Mecha Ritz: Steel Rondo is a great shooting game that is easily enjoyable by players at any skill level.  Among the things I've already mentioned it also features a decent story, quirky cafe based sense of humor, FM synth soundtrack, and the ability to watch replays of your runs.  It would have been really nice to have Steam achievements and leaderboards, but it doesn't actually detract from the game itself. HEY has truly created an excellent shoot 'em up, and it's probably one of the first games that would come to mind when suggesting a game for someone that wanted an introduction to the genre.  I absolutely recommend Mecha Ritz: Steel Rondo.

[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/25660729-CelerySpin/]Like the review? Follow my curator page to see my thoughts on other games.[/url]

24656008.review: Very good game with unique sound design. Must have for all shmup fans, regardless of their skill level. I have played the freeware version a lot more than the steam version but they're very similar.

24234155.review:
Mecha Ritzは説明しようのないほどに弾幕STGです。といっても東方Projectや最近のCAVEに代表されるような遅めの弾幕ではなく，目のくらむような高速弾でそのほとんどが構成されています。無料版があるらしいのですが未プレイです。演出など変わっているようですので，特別な理由がなければこちらのバージョンを購入して遊ぶのを強くオススメしたいです。

機械にもかかわらずまったく人間味あふれたフレーバー，言っている事はわかるのにその意味を汲み上げる事のほとんどが困難なストーリー，無尽蔵にあふれ出るボス，それに織り成す天才少女の趣味全開のネーミングセンス，幻想的な色彩の敵に埋め尽くされ画面中を走り回る高速の弾幕，それらが有機的に絡み合って始終アッパーなテンションで上機嫌に展開するゲーム進行は独特なプレイ感があります。
STGの面白さが何なのかは正直よくわからない人間ですが，遊んでいる時の「なんだかただごとではないゲームを遊んでいるぞ……」といった感触そのものはかなり現実味あふれていて，今直面しているゲームに対して表現する言葉を持たないのであればこれが「面白い」という事で，製作者さんが仰る「誰かの心を動かす要素」に通ずるものなのかなと思いました。特に真ボスの演出は完全に心を打たれ，まだこういう表現方法が生きていたのかと感心しきりでした。

ゲーム内容に関しては初期のRED機が弾幕STG的に凄くオーソドックスなショット・レーザータイプで，そこから徐々に尖った性能の機体になっていくという仕組みが良かったです。コアであるランクシステムはかなり動的に変化する上に影響される要素が非常に多岐に渡っており個人的にはコントロールが難しく感じました。
細かい所だとこのゲームはアイテム全般が「破壊で取得」という昨今やや珍しい形態となっており，本来弾幕STGでは混戦中にアイテムを取得に行くというのは，ある程度のリスクを持ったパターンを組まなければいけない場合が多いため，非常に安心してプレイ出来ました（ただ，ボムとシールドが両方増えるダブルの出現条件が近接撃破なのである意味ではトレードオフとも言えますが）。

少しだけ不満があるとすれば，プレイを重ねる事で徐々にアンロックされていくシステムは自分はあまり好みじゃなかったです。1プレイが尋常ではない密度を誇る内容なので連続プレイがしんどいという個人的な事情と，自機の種類やランクなどゲームのミニマムとマキシマムを知っておきたいとか，色々な面や条件を試したい，一度見た物はすぐにいつでも見直したいなど好奇心があるのですが，それが段階的に解放される事でゲームプレイに対する欲求がずいぶん制御されてしまっているなと思いました（あくまで僕自身の好き嫌いの話ですが……）。ただ，こういったゲームに慣れていない人は普通に遊んでいるうちに解禁されていくのかもしれません。
あとはちょっと被弾の原因がわかりづらいかも？　と思いました。ただ基本的には膨大なリソースの元，潤沢なシールドとボムに守られているので普通にプレイする分にはあまり問題はないと思います。

散漫な内容ですがこんな感じで，少しでも何かの参考になれば幸いです。

24178144.review:
STG初心者です。
トレイラーの音楽がかっこいいという理由で購入し、
先日やっと表をクリアしました。裏？はこれから頑張ります。
他の方と同じような内容となりますが、こちらにも書かせていただきます。

[h1]◎おすすめポイント[/h1]
[list]
    [*]音楽が超超超かっこいい。サントラは絶対買おう。
    [*]中ボスの紹介が面白い。
    [*]中ボスがたくさん出てくるためテンポがいい。
    [*]ボムもシールドも頻繁に補給されるのでガンガン攻めに行ける
    [*]低ランクだと弾が画面下部で消えるので弾が怖くて後ろに張り付いちゃう人も安心。ただ全部消えるわけではないので、消えると思って油断してると逆にひやっとするかも。
    [*]システムがそんなにややこしくない。
    [*]女の子が可愛い
[/list]

[h1]△ちょっと残念？な点[/h1]
[list]
    [*]コンティニューが無いので最初は心が折れそうになった。コミュニティにある製作者からのメッセージ曰く、シューティングやったことのない人もどうぞとのことですが、そういう人はこの点でつまずくかも。
    [*]体力を削りきって敵の撃破演出が入り加点されるまでが長いので、その間にタイムボーナスが切れるとイラっとする。
[/list]

シューティング初心者でも十分楽しめるゲームだと思います。
音楽かっこいいけどこういうゲーム得意じゃない･･･って人も買って損はないです。

23927496.review: Wonderful little shump that is exactly microtargetted at the exact spot where it has neat new ideas that are never hard to grasp or obtuse, and borrows just enough of what we know works to feel like it's pilfering the good stuff without being stale or derivative.  Fantastic music and aesthetic to go with it too.

23627240.review:
*Note: I didn't have internet during the time I played the game so time on record is way off.

This is a fantastic shmup experience right here. Wonderful bullet spreads with gameplay that basically changes the better you are. As you do better, the spreads become harder and move faster, enemies power up, and YOU become stronger. It really gives a good sense of synergy for the player and just makes thing flow until you get crushed by a wall of bullets.

Speed, main attack, special attack, and bomb all differ from ship to ship offering unique playtroughs with each one. You're even given options to change certain color aesthetics of the game to you liking with more options unlocking the more you play. The game can also be customized a bit (manipulating the ranking, etc.) before jumping into the action.

The music, sound, and aesthetics of the game offer some kind of retro/cyber punkish kind of feel to it. The tracks in the game are great, sound effects are pleasing and never get old, and the game is colorfull and full of fantastic designs. 

This is definitely a title that deserves to be held up above the droves of other shmups that are rushing into the market. Fans of the genre shouldn't think twice about adding this to their library of games. Even at full price this game is less than a premium fast food meal and tastes even better.

23574554.review:
Mecha Ritz is practically a playground to hone your skills and getting in touch with the rank system, which is  common in most shmups. 

You have 12 mechs each with its pros and cons. There are even ones with special mechanics, but I won't talk about it to not spoiler it. 

You can adjust everything to your liking from the colour of the enemy bullets to the rank you gonna start with. 
You can basically create every difficulty you want in this game. On the highest one the game looks more like a dodonpachi saidaioujou in terms of bullet speed and enemy clusters. 

The game is fairly short..the length of a normal shmup. The bosses are nice.

The price for this, my so called " playground", is o.k. . You get a lot of content and you can dictate what difficulty you wanna start at. The soundtrack is not as awesome as some other shmups, but still fits the mood of the game.

From me definitely a thumb up. This is a game from everyone and welcomes new players in the genre extremly well.

23512952.review:
Don't let the rough, low-fi graphics fool you. This game has a soul of cast iron. A fast, twitchy shmup in the vein of Cave's best, but with a focus on branching progression (Clear levels fast and efficiently and more routes poen up) and dynamic difficulty. Stay alive and kill quickly and the game gets harder, with bullet patterns becoming more complex and enemies getting new powers. Thankfully, taking hits, using smartbombs or (ithe absolute worst) losing a life will drop things back down to something more manageable.

Even a crusty old coot like me managed to get the most basic ending after a few tries, although I've barely scratched the surface of what the game offers.

A single playthrough of this should clock in at around 25-30 minutes, but if you want to see all 15 stages and unlock every ship? you're going to have to play this A LOT.

23512096.review:
It's always nice when you stumble across a game you haven't heard of before and it just blindsides you with its quality.

Mecha Ritz is a bullet hell shmup that packs a downright bold retro aesthetic and a soundtrack that is just gnarly, furthering immersing you in the aesthetic it's trying to pull off (and boy does it pull it off).

You have a great selection of ships with abilities that are fun and more or less equally capable of taking you through the game, a difficulty system that scales itself to how well you're doing, going downright crazy in the harder difficulties,  branching paths leading to multiple endings, great art and enemy designs that are somehow hilarious while still looking badass (There's a boss robot named SOY La-Tay... And a lot of enemies have various coffee themed names that are all pretty clever) and to top it all off, there's a story in between all the bullets that actually doesn't seem too half bad.

A young girl genius named Veloce discovered "Mecha" and has exterminated all of humanity, creating a world of steel machines for her to dominate over. Years pass and one machine, curiously human in its actions, has gained sentience. The collective souls of humanity has somehow converged into the machine, and boy are they ANGRY. You carry out their will and seek to mete out retribution against the tyrannical Volece and give peace to the tortured human souls.

And crazy as it sounds, it ends up being a captivating story. You want to find out what's going on, why things had to be that way, and it just works. 

Some other very nice touches were the option to change the enemies bullet and explosion colors. You have to unlock them, but having this option is really appreciated, as if you don't feel the bullets are visible, you can change them to a color that is, and there seems to be enough to satisfy anyone. This to me is a really neat feature as a common complaint in these shmup games is that bullets can be hard to see, so it was smart of them to make it an option to change the colors. 


I highly recommend this game and also recommend you pick up the soundtrack. It's amazing and with the bundle provided, it's just a little bit more for a great OST and game that SHMUP fans can enjoy.

23498529.review: Very fun game, nice graphics and sound

23498471.review:
Normally i would wait until i finished or put some hours till i write a review, but with Mecha Ritz there is no such thing as common sense :)

It's a perfect blend of modern and classic shmups elements full with moments of adrenaline! It can be overwhelming, fast, exhilarating, chaotic, gorgeous but the most important thing, it's fun, especially thanks to the dynamic difficulty that switches in real time so that it's always fair and a challenge for the player.

regardless of whether you're a veteran or a newcomer, I would even say if you are new to the genre or want to try something with fresh ideas, modern gameplay and retro look then Mecha Ritz is perfect as a starting point!!!

It's already a classic in the genre for me and i could easily see it in my personal top5!

23494300.review:
An absolute tour de force. A shmup full of imaginative patterns, chaos, and rapid-fire fun. Magnificently paced, endlessly charming. Mecha Ritz really does earn its spot proudly right next to Crimzon Clover, Eschatos, and Mushihimesama. It is that good.

The rank system slides perfectly up and down, making the game faster and more chaotic, but you stronger, the better you do, and easier the more you take it on the chin. This creates a wonderful risk vs reward metric by making the game more and more intense the better you play. Combine with all the extra lives it gives you (A ridiculous amount compared to others in the genre. I would get 3-5 shields and 3-5 bombs usually each level.), and the game manages to make room for terrible play as well as reward extremely good play with crazier patterns.

Of course, you have to manage a decent rank to get the best ending, but even the bad ending is a rip roaring good time.

But even without the rank system, you have a game that is just brilliantly put together in every way. Do not let this one pass you by if you like shmups at all.

EDIT: The manual is a readme.txt file in the game install directory and explains the various systems. This is old school as can be.

23494226.review:
単色の自機と敵機、それらが七色に組み合わさったサイケデリックな色使い。ボスの登場に合わせて、仰々しいフォントが語る奇抜な三行詩。本作を構成する要素は凡夫の理解を軽く超えていて、それもそのはず、この作品は天才少女の現代アートなのだから。ステージの幕間に出てくる少女の語りは平易ながらも難解で、じっくりと咀嚼しながら先に進もう。BGMが気に入ったなら、DLCにあるサウンドトラックでじっくりと聴いてみるのもいい。音楽それ自体もさることながら、曲のタイトルから自然と溢れ出る独特のセンスにも、きっと惹かれることだろう。

そんな奇天烈なビジュアルとストーリーを持ちながらも、シューティングゲームとしては奇を衒うことなく、手堅くまとまっている。8方向キーでの移動にショットとボムの2ボタン、ショットはボタンを押し続けることで変化する。一定時間無敵になれるボムと、被弾を許容するシールド、そしてそれらを運んでくるキャリアー。道中では中ボスを何度か繰り返したのち、最後に待ち受けるボスを倒せばステージクリア。そんなオーソドックスな構成だけれど、それでもボスが次々に登場するスピード感は遊んでいて気持ちいいし、敵弾幕は職人芸的な美しさを見せてくれる。加えて良く練られたランクシステムのおかげで、上級者には難しく、初心者には易しくなる設計。どこまでも天才少女の手のひらの上で転がされている感覚が味わえる。

一見すると癖の強い印象を受けるかもしれないけど、遊んだらきっとやみつきになる。食わず嫌いせずに、まずは一度プレイしてみて欲しい作品。

23488612.review:
I love shmups almost as much as I suck at them.

Most other shmups (bullet hells especially) straight-up keep you from going to later levels if you play on easy or use continues. In Mecha Ritz, I didn't get punished for being awful with no ending, I got to fight a really cool boss and won while I was one hit away from death. This game makes it easy for me to enjoy the bullet hell experience while still feeling like I'm actually good at the game.

Oh, yeah: the FM synth music is amazing.

The only real problem I had with the game is that there's no explanation whatsoever as to how things work. How do you gain Rank? What is Heat? Why do bosses shoot a million bullets that then disappear? A game manual or tutorial would fix this right up.

Eventually I'll get the hang of the scoring/ranking system and I won't be as terrible. I can only imagine how much more fun the game will be then.

23488122.review:
Man this game is rad.

Mecha Ritz is a shoot em up game with a strong focus on its adaptive rank system which increases and decreases the difficulty depending on your actions in the game. As a result of this system, clearing the game is pretty easy. I'm a mediocre shmup player and was able to clear it on my first attempt with several lives left over. However clearing the game is not really the point. The real meat of this game revolves around the scoring system. The scoring system in the game mostly revolves around trying to push the rank as high as possible as well as speedkilling and point-blanking enemies. It's simple, but due to the games excellent use of the ranking system it always creates an exciting scoring experience for all skill levels. Player's will find themselves at a rank high above where they're comfortable and frantically dodging in order to try and keep it for going down. It's an adrenaline rush that needs to be experienced to be understood. 

To top it all off the game has excellent visual presentation, fantastic music, TATE support, and a very customizable practice mode that allows you to switch ship types on the fly. My only real complaint is the lack of leaderboards given the game's focus on scoring. Some achievements would have also been nice but certainly aren't a deal breaker. 

Regardless, I highly recommend this game to anyone interested in the genre. There's enough here to engage and challenge both newcomers and veterans to the genre making the game very open to all. If you are unsure, there is also a freeware version available online with less features and no translation but still a similar and exciting experience.

23483694.review:
Mecha Ritz is an innovative shmup with a uniquely manic pace thanks to its adaptive difficulty system and creative patterns.

MR's big gimmick is that it adjusts the game's difficulty on the fly, according to players performance's, and awards higher scores to higher difficulty runs. This isn't a new concept, having been done many times before in a variety of ways, but Mecha Ritz executes it with a very special flavor. When you play well, the game's difficulty ramps like an out of control roller coaster, providing instant feedback and a dazzling light show of chaos. "But wait!" you might be shouting while raising your finger inquisitively, "doesn't that mean the game must be really really hard? I don't like the sound of being punished for doing well". Well, actually, the games difficulty drops just as fast and as hard as it rises (once again, going back to the roller coaster analogy). This is both a blessing and a curse, because the game does lack the tension of constantly fighting for your existence that is so vital to the genre, but scoring and seeing how far you can push the chaos takes that drive's place, and allows the game to become even more manic (and at times, completely insane) while feeling rewarding and fair.

Beyond the adaptive difficulty, for me, the game's true strength is more fundamental. Even if the difficulty were set in place, Mecha Ritz is a masterpiece of adrenaline fueled pacing and cleverly designed stages and bosses. Stages are filled with unique setpieces and mini-bosses who rapidly jump in and out of the spotlight like over-excited circus performers relishing their time on stage. Bullet patterns and hazards do a brilliant job of forcing you to keep moving at high speed, as opposed to the slow microscopic dodges in most bullet hell games, and make dodging feel thrilling, free, and fun, without sacrificing any of the engagingly mind-bending chaos of traditional bullet hell shooters.

Mecha Ritz is a game that proves just how vital this oldest and purest of game genres still is, and the unending possibility for creativity that lies within it. With its over the top manic gameplay and quirky audiovisual presentation, Mecha Ritz has easily become one of my top 3 shmups ever made. Highly recommended.


PS: If you're on the fence, try the original freeware version. It lacks much of the polish and content of this version, and annoyingly forces you to unlock any level of difficulty beyond easy, but it's fundamental charm is much the same.

23483383.review:
[h1]初めに[/h1]
Mecha Ritz: Steel Rondoは、弾幕系のシューティングゲームです。
このゲームはフリーゲーム（Mecha Ritz）の有料版です。違いは多々ありますが、基本のシステムは変わらないので迷っている方は参考に遊んでみるのも良いかもしれません。

[h1]ゲームシステム[/h1]（readmeに詳しく書いてありますが、簡単に）
・ランクシステム
このゲームの難易度はランクシステムが全てで、決まった難易度設定はありません。（但しタイトル画面でスタート時のランクが設定できる）
ランクが上昇すると、敵の攻撃が激しくなる上に弾速も上昇していきますが、自機の攻撃もパワーアップします。
ランクは得点アイテムの取得などの点数が増える行為で上昇し、被弾で減少します。

・アイテム
特定の敵を倒す事で入手することができ、シールドは5個、ボムは10個までストックすることができます。ストックをオーバーして入手した場合、ボーナスで得点が増え、ランクが上昇します。

・その他
このゲームはストーリ分岐が存在します。

[h1]良い点、悪い点[/h1]
・良い点
ランクシステムのバランスが良い
音楽、グラフィック、SE、どれを取っても素晴らしい出来、爽快感がある
ボス、中ボスのテロップが楽しい

・悪い点、悪い点かもしれない所
自機の当たり判定が分かりにくい
撃破演出が長いボスの場合、演出の最中に時間切れになる時があり、タイムボーナスが入手出来ない時がある
一部で実質的にボムが必須の所があり、人によっては理不尽に感じるかもしれない

[h1]評価[/h1]
荒削りな所も目立ちますが、良い点で上げた要素が本当に良く、モチベーションが保ちやすいので個人的にはとても楽しめます。
消す弾幕ゲーが好きならお勧めです。
